titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Miriam Schlein Papers
titlestmt.author: by Jennifer Meehan and Leigh Golden

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday April 6, 2019 at 03:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists primarily of writings, including drafts and manuscripts, and research material, as well as correspondence, clippings, printed material, photographs, slides, phonographic records and other material. The collection documents Miriam Schlein's career as a children's author and her process of researching and writing books on natural history and related topics.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Miriam Schlein Papers were purchased from Elizabeth S. Weiss and John Weiss on the Jockey Hollow Fund, 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Miriam Schlein Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Miriam Schlein Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and organization. Descriptive information is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Books from the Schlein collection are cataloged separately, with their provenance traced.

bioghist.head: Miriam Schlein (1926-2004)
bioghist.p: Miriam Schlein was born on 6 June 1926 in Brooklyn, NY. Schlein was a prolific author of children's books which focused on teaching young readers about animals, science, and other topics. She earned a B.A. in psychology from Brooklyn College in 1947 before moving into the fields of publishing and advertising.

While working for the publisher Simon & Schuster in the children's department, she was inspired to write her own books for children. Beginning with 1951's A Day at the Playground , she went on to write nearly one hundred books over five decades. Although she wrote a number of fiction stories, such as Oomi, the New Hunter (1955), The Snake in the Carpool (1963), and I Sailed with Columbus (1991), she concentrated on books which explored the natural sciences. Among her award-winning efforts in this genre are Fast Is Not a Ladybug: A Book about Fast and Slow Things (1953), Elephant Herd (1954), What's Wrong with Being a Skunk? (1974), Giraffe, the Silent Giant (1976), The Dangerous Life of the Sea Horse (1986), and Discovering Dinosaur Babies (1991).
Miriam Schlein married Harvey Weiss, an artist who illustrated some of her early works. Before her marriage with Weiss ended in divorce, the couple had two children.
Miriam Schlein died of vasculitis on 23 November 2004 in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of writings, including drafts and manuscripts, and research material, as well as correspondence, clippings, printed material, photographs, slides, phonographic records and other material. The collection documents Miriam Schlein's career as a children's author and her process of researching and writing books on natural history and related topics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four series: I. Writing Files, 1955-2002; II. Research Material, 1949-2003; III. Correspondence, 1954-2002; and IV. Personal Papers, 1976-2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists primarily of drafts, manuscripts, and notes for many of Schlein's published works as well as some of her uncompleted book projects. Also found is some research material and correspondence relating to Schlein's published works.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Related material can be found in Research Material and Correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged in alphabetical order by book or project title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to the book, Snake Fights, Rabbit Fights, & More: A Book About Animal Fighting .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of material created and accumulated by Schlein in the course of researching topics for her books, and planning and carrying out various book projects. Material includes mostly clippings, notes, and book proposals, as well as some writings and correspondence.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Related material can be found in Writing Files and Correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged in alphabetical order by topic or title.

did.unittitle: Bits That Grow Big: The Story Of Plant Reproduction by Irma E. Webber

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes notes for "Secret Land Of The Past".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings associated with op-ed pieces, "Go With The Sun", "Something For Now, Something For Later", and other works by Miriam Schlein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence with publishers, authors, fans, and others, relating to the publication and reception of Schlein's books. Correspondence can also be found in Writing Files and Research Material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged in alphabetical order by subject or correspondenct.

scopecontent.p: Includes letters from Maurice Sendak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes photographs, financial papers, awards, book lists, printed material, and audio-visual material, variously relating to aspects of Schlein's personal and professional life.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are largely arranged in alphabetical order with printed material and audio-visual material arranged at the end.
